# Introduction

The rapid advancement of **Artificial Intelligence (AI)** has sparked an ongoing debate:  
ğŸš€ Is AI replacing human workers, or is it creating more jobs than it destroys?  

This study dives into **the dual impact of AI**â€”exploring both **job displacement risks** and **emerging AI-driven career opportunities** across industries.

With AI-driven automation on the rise, **workers in every field** must rethink their skill sets, adapt to **new technologies**, and find ways to **future-proof their careers**.

---

# Why This Study Matters

The intersection of **AI and employment** is a crucial area of study in **2025**, with direct implications for:
âœ… **Employees** â€“ How to adapt and upskill in an AI-powered world.  
âœ… **Employers** â€“ Balancing automation with human workforce needs.  
âœ… **Governments** â€“ Policies to manage job displacement.

4. **What should job seekers do to remain competitive?**  

These questions are **not just theoretical**â€”they are **critical for job seekers, policymakers, and businesses** adapting to this shift.

# AIâ€™s Role in Job Disruption vs. Job Creation

AI is **not just replacing jobsâ€”it is also creating new roles** at an unprecedented pace.  
The **World Economic Forum (2024)** predicts that **85 million jobs** will be displaced, but **97 million new roles** will emerge.
